intro: Pterichis bangii, commonly known as the Bangi's pterichis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
